info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 9 at 3:57AM CDT until June 9 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Norman OK
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oklahoma...
Blue River near Blue affecting Bryan County.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Blue River near Blue.
* WHEN...From early this morning to this evening.
* IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, The river remains largely within its banks... throughout Bryan County. Inflows from local streams could cause minor overflows to reach very low fields for a short while. Only farmlands are affected.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 AM CDT Monday the stage was 21.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 28.0 feet. - Forecast...The Blue River is expected to rise to a crest of 27.0 feet this afternoon. - Action stage is 26.0 feet. - Flood stage is 28.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO THIS EVENING
